articles.author: Laila Bassam, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israel's Mossad spy agency planted a small amount of explosives inside 5,000 Taiwan-made pagers ordered by Lebanese group Hezbollah months before Tuesday's detonations, a senior Lebanese security source and another source told Reuters.
articles.title: Israel planted explosives in Hezbollah's Taiwan-made pagers, say sources

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations General Assembly will on Wednesday adopt a Palestinian-drafted resolution that demands Israel end "its unlawful presence in the Occupied Palestinian Territory" within 12 months.
articles.title: UN to demand Israel end 'unlawful' presence in Palestinian territories within 12 months

articles.author: Ami Miyazaki, Shiho Tanaka
articles.description: 海上保安庁は１８日朝、防衛省の情報として、北朝鮮から弾道ミサイルの可能性があるものが発射されたと発表した。発表は２回で、１回目は午前６時５７分ごろ、２回目は７時２８分ごろ。いずれもすでに落下したとみられるという。
articles.title: 北朝鮮から弾道ミサイルの可能性あるもの、海保が2回発表　すでに落下

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Jihadist groups in Burkina Faso have escalated attacks on civilians, often in retaliation against communities for refusing to join their ranks or allegedly collaborating with government troops, Human Rights Watch said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Islamist groups escalate retaliatory attacks on Burkina Faso civilians, HRW says

articles.author: Emilio Parodi, Elisa Anzolin, Denis Balibouse, Mimosa Spencer
articles.description: "Made in Italy: shame in Italy," a handful of migrant labourers who had travelled from Italy's famed leatherware region Tuscany chanted last week in Geneva outside the flagship store of luxury accessory maker Montblanc, holding placards with the slogan.
articles.title: How migrant workers suffered to craft the 'Made in Italy' luxury label

articles.author: Fayaz Bukhari
articles.description: Voters queued outside polling stations in India's Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday to vote in the first provincial election being held in a decade in the Himalayan region that has grappled with years of militant violence.
articles.title: India's Jammu and Kashmir votes in first regional poll in a decade

articles.author: Francesco Guarascio, Phuong Nguyen
articles.description: Vietnam's president and ruling Communist Party chief To Lam is set to meet representatives from several U.S. corporations, including Google and Meta, during a visit to the United States next week, two people briefed about the plans told Reuters.
articles.title: Vietnam's top leader Lam to meet Google, Meta in US next week, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An attack with explosives by Colombian leftist rebel group the National Liberation Army (ELN), which left more than two dozen troops injured and two dead, has "practically" ended peace talks, Colombia's President Gustavo Petro said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Colombia's Petro says ELN attack 'practically' ends peace talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Music mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs has been hit with three federal charges of racketeering conspiracy, sex trafficking and transportation to engage in prostitution, according to an indictment unsealed on Tuesday.
articles.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs charged with racketeering, sex trafficking

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's Gold Apollo did not make the pagers that were used in the detonations in Lebanon on Tuesday, the company's founder Hsu Ching-Kuang told reporters on Wednesday.
articles.title: Gold Apollo says it did not make pagers used in Lebanon explosions
